etymologies: early 17th century (in an earlier sense). As noun from classical Latin opisthotonicus a person suffering from opisthotonos, in post-classical Latin also a horse suffering from opisthotonos; as adjective from its etymon Hellenistic Greek οπισθοτονικός relating to, or affected with opisthotonos from ancient Greek ὀπισθότονος + -ικός

definitions: Of, relating to, or affected with opisthotonos.
